title: MS SQL Server DBA - USA-CA-Irvine
text:
Profile 
MS SQL Server DBA 
Content.Ad is a leader in the explosive digital content marketing space. The firm works with both publishers and advertisers to develop and post high quality, highly informative content that creates an effective new lead generation and sales funnel for clients. Content.Ad works with national marketers and other clients seeking to acquire new customers online quickly, effectively and inexpensively. The company operates one of the largest sponsored content networks. 
Job Summary: 
Provide technical and operational Microsoft SQL Server support for large scale transactional relational databases. Manage highly reliable, high performance database processing environments. Execute changes to SQL Server databases: tuning, testing, and coding, where necessary. Provide effective technical expertise for projects in collaboration with developers to aid development teams in design and testing of high performance coding techniques. Focus on ensuring database security, tuning, availability, recoverability and performance. Troubleshooting and solving operational issues directly related to the operation of MS SQL Server. 
Responsible for providing operational database services to the organization. Some of the primary responsibilities of this role include: owning, tracking and resolving database related incidents and requests, fulfilling requests and resolving incidents within SLAs, reviewing service related reports (e.g: database backups, maintenance, monitoring) on a daily basis to ensure service related issues are identified and resolved within established SLAs, responding to database related alerts and escalations and working with other colleagues in Engineering to come up with strategic solutions to recurring problems. 
Job Responsibilities: Significant support for enterprise mission-critical databases. Develop plans, coordinate design/deployment efforts and lead activities within technical team. Perform troubleshooting and accurate root cause analysis for resolving database problems, particularly with performance tuning. Assist architects in developing technical strategies, architectures and futures with awareness of business customer requirements and corporate goals. Aid architects in implementing strategies in a seamless manner. Perform database monitoring and diagnostics. Support best practices in performance tuning and optimization. Design and provide effective monitoring, logging and reporting best practices. Design and implement process solutions to perform database upgrades that are effective and avoid disruptions. Work with project and production support teams to develop, implement and administer complex procedures. Provide after-hours and weekend support for a 24/7 system availability model. Design, develop and deploy disaster recovery and archiving processes and procedures. Assist in planning, implementing and maintaining a production MS SQL database server environment. Support a robust security program by following best practices related to the database server environment. Respond to database-oriented Engineering help desk requests. Maintain system performance with operations staff by performing system monitoring and analysis, and performance tuning Provide technical mentoring to the other DBA’s in the team and assist with solution assessment and designs 
Minimum Qualifications: Bachelor’s degree in a technical field or five (5) years of technical experience. At least four (4) years of experience supporting Internet scale relational databases. At least five (5) years of experience managing MS SQL Server. Experience in Performance Tuning and Optimization (PTO), using native monitoring and troubleshooting tools. Experience with backups, restores and database recovery models. Knowledge of High Availability (HA) and Disaster Recovery (DR) options for MSSQL Server. Experience with MS SQL Server replication. Strength in AWS environments
